questions.question: Which cooking method retains the most nutrients?
questions.explanation: Steaming preserves most nutrients since it minimizes water loss and oxidation.
questions.funFact: Steam your veggies for maximum vitamins!

questions.question: How much water should you drink per kg of body weight?
questions.explanation: 30–35 ml/kg body weight daily supports hydration and metabolism.
questions.funFact: Hydration improves focus and energy!

questions.explanation: Protein is essential for muscle growth and repair.
questions.funFact: Protein-rich foods support strength and recovery.

questions.question: Which vitamin is produced when your skin is exposed to sunlight?
questions.explanation: Sunlight helps the body produce Vitamin D, essential for bones and immunity.
questions.funFact: Just 15 minutes of sunlight daily boosts Vitamin D levels!

questions.question: Which fruit is richest in Vitamin C?
questions.explanation: Guava is among the richest natural sources of Vitamin C, even more than oranges.
questions.funFact: Vitamin C supports strong immunity and glowing skin!

questions.question: Which meal of the day should be the heaviest?
questions.explanation: Lunch should be the heaviest to fuel the body during the day when metabolism is higher.
questions.funFact: A balanced lunch gives sustained energy for afternoon tasks.

questions.question: Which vitamin is produced when your skin is exposed to sunlight?
questions.explanation: Sunlight helps the body produce Vitamin D, essential for bones and immunity.
questions.funFact: Just 15 minutes of sunlight daily boosts Vitamin D levels!

questions.question: Which is a healthier dessert option?
questions.explanation: Fruit salad provides natural sweetness and fiber without added sugar or oil.
questions.funFact: Fresh fruits make guilt-free desserts!

questions.question: True or False: Carbohydrates should be completely avoided to lose weight.
questions.explanation: False — complex carbs like oats and brown rice are essential for energy and fiber.
questions.funFact: Choose whole grains instead of cutting carbs completely!

questions.question: How many glasses of water are generally recommended per day?
questions.explanation: 6–8 glasses (about 2 liters) per day help maintain hydration and kidney health.
questions.funFact: Keep a water bottle handy to sip through the day!

questions.question: True or False: Eating nuts daily is bad for heart health.
questions.explanation: False — nuts like almonds and walnuts are rich in healthy fats that protect the heart.
questions.funFact: A handful of nuts a day keeps your heart healthy!

questions.question: True or False: Eating nuts daily is bad for heart health.
questions.explanation: False — nuts like almonds and walnuts are rich in healthy fats that protect the heart.
questions.funFact: A handful of nuts a day keeps your heart healthy!

questions.question: True or False: Drinking warm water helps digestion.
questions.explanation: True — warm water can aid digestion and improve circulation.
questions.funFact: A glass of warm water after meals can ease digestion.

questions.explanation: Sunlight helps the body produce Vitamin D, essential for bones and immunity.
questions.funFact: Just 15 minutes of sunlight daily boosts Vitamin D levels!

questions.funFact: A balanced lunch gives sustained energy for afternoon tasks.

questions.explanation: 6–8 glasses (about 2 liters) per day help maintain hydration and kidney health.
questions.funFact: Keep a water bottle handy to sip through the day!

questions.question: Which is a healthier dessert option?
questions.explanation: Fruit salad provides natural sweetness and fiber without added sugar or oil.
questions.funFact: Fresh fruits make guilt-free desserts!

questions.question: Which nutrient helps improve vision?
questions.explanation: Vitamin A supports eye health and helps prevent night blindness.
questions.funFact: Carrots and spinach are great for your eyes!

questions.question: True or False: Carbohydrates should be completely avoided to lose weight.
questions.explanation: False — complex carbs like oats and brown rice are essential for energy and fiber.
questions.funFact: Choose whole grains instead of cutting carbs completely!

questions.question: Which is a healthier cooking oil option?
questions.explanation: Mustard oil contains healthy monounsaturated fats and omega-3s, beneficial for the heart.
questions.funFact: Traditional oils like mustard are heart-friendly when used in moderation.

questions.question: Which meal of the day should be the heaviest?
questions.explanation: Lunch should be the heaviest to fuel the body during the day when metabolism is higher.
questions.funFact: A balanced lunch gives sustained energy for afternoon tasks.

questions.question: Which vitamin is produced when your skin is exposed to sunlight?
questions.explanation: Sunlight helps the body produce Vitamin D, essential for bones and immunity.
questions.funFact: Just 15 minutes of sunlight daily boosts Vitamin D levels!

questions.question: True or False: Drinking warm water helps digestion.
questions.explanation: True — warm water can aid digestion and improve circulation.
questions.funFact: A glass of warm water after meals can ease digestion.

questions.question: True or False: Eating nuts daily is bad for heart health.
questions.explanation: False — nuts like almonds and walnuts are rich in healthy fats that protect the heart.
questions.funFact: A handful of nuts a day keeps your heart healthy!

questions.question: Which nutrient helps improve vision?
questions.explanation: Vitamin A supports eye health and helps prevent night blindness.
questions.funFact: Carrots and spinach are great for your eyes!

questions.question: Which fruit is richest in Vitamin C?
questions.explanation: Guava is among the richest natural sources of Vitamin C, even more than oranges.
questions.funFact: Vitamin C supports strong immunity and glowing skin!

questions.question: How many glasses of water are generally recommended per day?
questions.explanation: 6–8 glasses (about 2 liters) per day help maintain hydration and kidney health.
questions.funFact: Keep a water bottle handy to sip through the day!
